title: Grow Your Dream: A Guide to a Productive Vegetable Garden

tasks.task: Planting and maintaining a vegetable garden at home.
subtasks: Choosing vegetables suitable for local climate, garden size, and preferences.
Planting vegetables in well-draining, enriched soil.
Monitoring for pests and diseases, and using organic solutions.
Regular weeding to prevent nutrient, water, and sunlight competition.
Providing support (e.g., stakes, cages) to plants as needed.
Harvesting vegetables at the appropriate time using sharp tools.
Enriching soil with organic matter (e.g., compost, manure).
Observing plants for pest and disease signs.
Employing organic methods to control pests and diseases.
Selecting appropriate support structures (stakes, cages, trellises).
Attaching plants to supports as needed.
Timing harvest according to vegetable type (e.g., young for zucchini, ripened on the plant for tomatoes).
Using proper tools to avoid plant damage.
